# Functions

sir(rn, s, i, u, p, stochastic) ⇒ Array

The SIR Model. Returns the model as a model class from the model module.

seir(rn, s, i, u, a, p, stochastic) ⇒ Array

The SEIR Model. Returns the model as a model class from the model module.

seird(rn, s, i, u, a, d, p, stochastic) ⇒ Array

The SEIRD Model. Returns the model as a model class from the model module.

# sir(rn, s, i, u, p, stochastic) ⇒ Array

The SIR Model. Returns the model as a model class from the model module.

Kind: global function
Returns: Array - An array with the model class from the model module and the key.

Param Type Description
rn Number R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
s Number The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
i Number The Infected population at the beggining of th outbreak
u Number The recovery rate
p Number The total population.
stochastic Boolean Whether to make the model stochastic or not.

Example

let sirmodel = sir(4, 9999, 1, 1/21, 10000, true)

# seir(rn, s, i, u, a, p, stochastic) ⇒ Array

The SEIR Model. Returns the model as a model class from the model module.

Kind: global function
Returns: Array - An array with the model class from the model module and the key.

Param Type Description
rn Number R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
s Number The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
i Number The Infected population at the beggining of th outbreak
u Number The recovery rate
a Number The incubation period
p Number The total population.
stochastic Boolean Whether to make the model stochastic or not.

Example

seir(4, 9999, 1, 1/7, 1/7, 10000, true)

# seird(rn, s, i, u, a, d, p, stochastic) ⇒ Array

The SEIRD Model. Returns the model as a model class from the model module.

Kind: global function
Returns: Array - An array with the model class from the model module and the key.

Param Type Description
rn Number R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
s Number The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
i Number The Infected population at the beggining of the outbreak
u Number The recovery rate
a Number The incubation period
d Number The death rate
p Number The total population.
stochastic Boolean Whether to make the model stochastic or not.

Example

seird(4, 99999, 1, 1/21, 1/14, 1/100, 10000, true)

# seihrd(rn, s, i, u, uh, a, di, dh, h, p, stochastic) ⇒ Array

The SEIHRD Model. Returns the model as a model class from the model module.

Kind: global function
Returns: Array - An array with the model class from the model module and the key.

Param Type Description
rn Number R Naught, or the amount of people one infected infects whlie infected.
s Number The Susceptible population at the beggining of the outbreak
i Number The Infected population at the beggining of the outbreak
u Number The recovery rate for the infected population
uh Number The recovery rate for the hospitalized population
a Number The incubation period
di Number The death rate for the infected population
dh Number The death rate for the hospitalized population
h Number The hospitalization rate
p Number The total population.
stochastic Boolean Whether to make the model stochastic or not.

Example

seihrd(4, 9999, 1, 1/21, 1/40, 1/14, 1/100, 1/20, 1/30, 10000, true)
